data.title: AAA File and Access Your Case
data.meta_description: AAA File and Access Your Case alternative dispute resolution (ADR) made easy.
data.text:
Fast File a Case

Quickly file a case online with AAA using a contract and a demand form with guest access.

Fast File a Case

Filing a No-Fault Insurance case?

Chose one of the following links:

Minnesota Petition for No-Fault Arbitration

New York Insurance ADR Center

Filing an Illinois UM Case?

Chose one of the following links:

UM Demand for Arbitration

Quick Pay an Invoice

Quickly pay an invoice online with your AAA case number and Pay Pin with guest access.

Quick Pay an Invoice

NY Insurance Programs

Sign in to file and manage your AAA-administered New York Insurance Case including No-Fault, Uninsured Motorist (UM) and Supplemental Underinsured Motorist (SUM)

NY Insurance

What is a No-Fault Case?

How do I file a case?

Access & Manage a Case

(AAA WebFile®)

Sign in to your AAA account to access your case or the Panelist eCenter.

Sign in to Access & Manage a Case

Register for an Account

How do I File a Case?

Electronic Case Folder (“ECF”) Guidelines

ECF Guidelines FAQ

Learn about the Hearing Exhibits Feature

Filing a Mass Case Arbitration or Mediation?

To file at least 25 cases where the Employment/Workplace Mass Arbitration and Mediation Fee Schedule Costs of Arbitration and Mediation applies, click here. Cases must have similar claims against or on behalf of the same party or related parties and representation of the parties is consistent or coordinated across the cases.

To file at least 25 cases where the Consumer Mass Arbitration and Mediation Fee Schedule Costs of Arbitration and Mediation applies, click here. Cases must have similar claims against or on behalf of the same party or related parties and representation of the parties is consistent or coordinated across the cases.

To file at least 100 cases where the Mass Arbitration Fee Schedule for Non-Consumer and Non-Employment /Workplace Disputes applies, click here. Cases must have similar claims against or on behalf of the same party or related parties and representation of the parties is consistent or coordinated across the cases.
